text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I want to show you

how to make a simple, easy, fast but delicious
Korean Beef and Rice.

Not authentic, but trust me, you're going
to love it because it is delicious!

Let me run you through the list of ingredients
you'll need for the beef, because the rice

is just white Jasmine rice that is cooked
to the package instructions.
Ground Beef.

I've got ginger, garlic, brown sugar, sesame,
hot pepper flakes, and here I've got soy sauce

and a little bit of toasted sesame oil and
I also need some scallions for the top, and

a little bit of either light olive oil or
an avocado oil or a vegetable oil or anything

that's light in flavor and can stand up to
heat because right now I have it going in

a really hot pan because I want it to be really
hot when I add the beef in, so I'm going to

add the beef, break it up as much as you can
with your wooden spoon.

Now really important here with this recipe,
what makes it so delicious is that the beef,

you have to break it up as much as you can
as it's cooking, but it's also really important

that it cooks to the point where it almost
becomes crunchy if that makes any sense, so
you have to give it some time.

So while that's happening, you are going to
break it up as much as you can with your wooden
spoon periodically.

While that happens you're going to mix together
the ingredients for your sauce, so the soy,

the oil, and I've got to get the ginger and
the garlic in there along with the brown sugar,

you want to whisk this all together and then
you're just going to set it aside until you're

ready for it which is not right now, but it's
good to get it out of the way - oh my pepper
flakes as well.
But it's good t get it out of the way.

So I'm just going to cook my beef, breaking
it apart and doing what I have to do to make

sure it's evenly distributed in the pan and
it gets really crispy, delicious and almost
starts to crackle and pop.

So keep your eye on it, it can take a good
ten minutes but it is well worth it.
Now this!
That is exactly what you are looking for.

I have discarded some of the fat from the
pan because I don't want a lot of fat because

I don't like it swimming in grease, so I discarded
some of it but this is now perfect.

Perfect time to add the sauce which is so
flavorful, so delicious, and you are going

to let this simmer just for a couple of minutes
and then we will be ready to serve.
That looks perfect.

I've got some jasmine rice here that I've
cooked.

Get that one in there.

Oh my word!
That is so good.

Like, there are just no words for it.
